definition: Lee Hsien Loong (1952-), Singapore PAP politician, eldest son of Lee Kuan Yew 李光耀[Li3 Guang1 yao4], prime minister from 2004
plum
surname Li
to make visible/to reveal/prominent/conspicuous/(prefix) phanero-
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long

sentences.english: His son, Lee Hsien Loong, is Singapore's third and current prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 其子李显龙是新加坡的现任总理，也是第三任总理。

sentences.english: After the ceremony, Vice Premier Wu held a welcoming banquet for her Singaporean counterpart on his visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 随后，吴仪为李显龙访华举行了欢迎宴会。

sentences.english: In February 1952, our first son Hsien Loong was born.
sentences.chinese: 我们的大儿子李显龙在1952年2月出生。

definition: Lee Kuan Yew (1923-2015), founding father of modern Singapore, prime minister 1959-1990
Goh Chok Tong (1941-), Singapore businessman and politician, prime minister 1990-2004
Kevin Rudd (1957-), Australian politician, proficient in Mandarin, prime minister 2007-2010 and 2013
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
Muhammad Naguib (1901-1984), first president of the Republic of Egypt
People's Action Party (ruling party in Singapore)
Khamenei, Ayatollah Aly (1939-), Supreme Leader of Iran, aka Ali Khamenei
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
former prime minister
Hung Hsiu-chu (1948-), Taiwanese KMT politician
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
Suharto (1921-2008), former Indonesian general, president of the Republic of Indonesia 1967-1998
Netanyahu (name)/Benjamin Netanyahu (1949-), Israeli Likud politician, prime minister 1996-1999 and from 2009
Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
